scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler walks in and starts raiding the
fridge. Then Rachel comes out of the shower with a towel wrapped round her waist, drying
herself with another towel. Chandler and Rachel startle each other and she drops the towel
for a second and snatches the rug off the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That is it ! You just barge in here, you don't knock

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm sorry!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You have no respect for anybody's privacy!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Rachel, wait, wait.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, you wait! This is ridiculous!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can I just say one thing?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? What?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's a relatively open weave and I can still see your... nipular areas.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler walks in and starts raiding the
fridge. Then Rachel comes out of the shower with a towel wrapped round her waist, drying
herself with another towel. Chandler and Rachel startle each other and she drops the towel
for a second and snatches the rug off the couch.]

events.event_description: Chandler walks into Monica and Rachel's apartment and begins raiding the fridge.
Rachel emerges from the shower wrapped in a towel, drying herself with another towel.
Rachel and Chandler startle each other upon seeing each other in the scene.
Rachel drops her towel momentarily during the startled reaction.
Rachel snatches the rug off the couch after dropping her towel.
Rachel confronts Chandler about him barging into her apartment without knocking.
Chandler apologizes to Rachel for entering without knocking.
Rachel accuses Chandler of having no respect for privacy.
Chandler attempts to explain himself to Rachel.
Chandler comments on Rachel's open weave towel revealing her nipples.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her boyfriend Roger, talking to Rachel and
Monica.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, honey, honey, tell them the story about your patient who thinks things are, like, other things. Y'know? Like, the phone rings and she takes a shower.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: That's pretty much it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oops!

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: But you tell it really well, sweetie.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks. Okay, now go away so we can talk about you.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Okay. I'll miss you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Isn't he great?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He's so cute! And he seems to like you so much.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know, I know. So sweet... and so complicated. And for a shrink, he's not too shrinky, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, you think you'll do it on his couch?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't know, I don't know. I think that's a little weird, y'know? Vinyl.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okaaay. (To the guys, on the couch) Any of you guys want anything else?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yes, could I have one of those. (Points)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I'm sorry, we're all out of those. Anybody else?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Did I, uh, did I miss something?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, she's still upset because I saw her boobies.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You what? Wh what were you doing seeing her boobies?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It was an accident. Not like I was across the street with a telescope and a box of donuts.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, could we change the subject, please?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, 'cause hello, these are not her boobies, these are her breasts.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, Pheebs, I was hoping for more of a change.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I don't know why you're so embarrassed, they were very nice boobies.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nice? They were nice. I mean, that's it? I mean, mittens are nice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okaaay, (Gestures) rock, hard place, me.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: You're so funny! He's really funny! I wouldn't wanna be there when when the laughter stops.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoah whoah, back up there, Sparky. What'd you mean by that?

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Oh, just seems as though that maybe you have intimacy issues. Y'know, that you use your humour as a way of keeping people at a distance.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: I mean hey! I just met you, I don't know you from Adam. ...Only child, right? Parents divorced before you hit puberty.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uhhuh, how did you know that?

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: It's textbook.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey you guys. Hey, you all know my dad, right?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey! Hey, Mr. Trib!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, how long are you in the city?

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Just for a coupla days. I got a job midtown. I figure I'm better off staying with the kid than hauling my ass back and forth on the ferry. (Sees Roger) I don't know this one.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, this is my friend Roger.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Hey, hey. Good to meet you, Roger.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: You too, sir.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: (To Phoebe) What happened to the, uh, puppet guy?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Dad, dad. (Shakes his head)

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Oh, 'scuse me. So Ross, uh, how's the wife? (Ross whines and lays his head on Chandler's shoulder) Off there too, uh? Uh, Chandler, quick, say something funny!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her boyfriend Roger, talking to Rachel and
Monica.]

events.event_description: Phoebe introduces Roger to Rachel and Monica at Central Perk.
Phoebe asks Roger to tell a story about a patient who confuses everyday objects.
Roger confirms the story about his patient, indicating he is a psychiatrist.
Phoebe asks Roger to leave so they can talk privately.
Chandler comments on wanting a specific item, which Rachel informs is out of stock.
Chandler makes a joke about seeing Rachelâ€™s breasts, causing Rachel to request a change of subject.
Chandler comments on Rachel's breasts being nice, prompting Rachel to compare them to mittens.
Roger comments on Chandler's humor, suggesting he might have intimacy issues.
Roger deduces Chandler's background, stating he is an only child with divorced parents.
Joey introduces his father, Mr. Tribbiani, to the group at Central Perk.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Mr. Tribbiani is on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Gotta go. I miss you too, I love you, but it's getting real late now

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Snatches the phone) Hey Ma. Listen, I made the appointment with Dr. Bazida, and... Excuse me? (To his dad) Did you know this isn't Ma?

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Her name's Ronni. She's a pet mortician.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure. So how long you been... (Goes back to chopping)

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Remember when you were a little kid, I used to take you to the navy yard and show you the big ships?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Since then?!

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: No, it's only been six years. I just wanted to put a nice memory in your head so you'd know that I wasn't always such a terrible guy. ...Joe. Y'ever been in love?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...I d'know.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Then y'haven't. You're burning your tomatoes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You're one to talk. (Puts the mushrooms in a saucepan)

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Joe, your dad's in love big time. And the worst part of it is, it's with two different women.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh man. Please tell me one of 'em is Ma.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Of course, course one of 'em's Ma. What's the matter with you.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Mr. Tribbiani is on the phone.]

events.event_description: Mr. Tribbiani ends his phone call, indicating he has to go and expresses love to someone on the phone.
Joey takes the phone from Mr. Tribbiani and speaks to his mother, informing her about the appointment with Dr. Bazida.
Joey realizes the person on the phone is not his mother and questions Mr. Tribbiani about her identity.
Mr. Tribbiani clarifies that the woman is Ronni, a pet mortician, and not Joey's mother.
Joey comments on the time since he last visited the navy yard with his father.
Mr. Tribbiani reminisces about taking Joey to the navy yard and shows concern about Joey's understanding of love.
Joey dismisses Mr. Tribbiani's question about love with uncertainty.
Mr. Tribbiani comments that Joey has not been in love, implying it is a necessary experience.
Joey warns Mr. Tribbiani that he is burning his tomatoes while chopping ingredients.
Mr. Tribbiani reveals that he is in love with two women simultaneously, including Joey's mother.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is lamenting to everyone about hid dad's affair.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's like if you woke up one day and found out your dad was leading this double life. He's like actually some spy, working for the C.I.A. (Considers) That'd be cool.... This blows!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know, I mean, why can't parents just stay parents? (She walks over near Chandler and his gaze stays very obviously on her chest) Why do they have to become people? Why do they have... (Notices Chandler) Why can't you stop staring at my breasts?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Without looking up) What? (Looks up) What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did you not get a good enough look the other day?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, alright. We're all adults here, there's only one way to resolve this. Since you saw her boobies, I think, uh, you're gonna have to show her your peepee.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I don't see that happening?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: C'mon, he's right. Tit for tat.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well I'm not showing you my 'tat.'

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Intercom) It's Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: (Intercom) And Rog.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: C'mon up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Sarcastic) Oh, good. Rog is here.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's the matter with Rog?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, it's nothing, it's a little thing... I hate that guy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, so he was a little analytical. That's what he does, y'know? C'mon, he's not that bad.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'see, that's where you're wrong. Why would I marry her if I thought on any level thatthat she was a lesbian?

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: I dunno. Maybe you wanted your marriage to fail.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why? Why would I why? Why? Why? Why?

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: I don't know. Maybe maybe low self-esteem, maybe maybe to compensate for overshadowing a sibling, maybe you...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wait-wait, go back to that sibling thing.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know. I mean, it's conceivable that you wanted to sabotage your marriage so that the sibling would feel less of a failure in the eyes of the parents.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That that's ridiculous! I don't feel guilty for her failures!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh! So you think I'm a failure!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Isn't he good?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nonono, thatthat's not what I was saying...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know, all these years, I thought you were on my side. But maybe what you were doing was sucking up to Mom and Dad so they'd keep liking you better!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, I married a lesbian to make you look good!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You're right! I mean you're right! It wasn't just the Weebles, but it was the Weeble Play Palace, and and the Weebles' Cruise Ship. Oh, which had this little lifeboat for the Weebles to wobble in.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: That's tough. Tough stuff. C'mon, Pheebs, we're gonna catch that movie, we gotta get going.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. Feel better, Rachel, 'kay?

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Geez, we're gonna be late, sweetie...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. Listen, thanks for everything, Mon.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Listen guys, it was great seeing you again. Mon, um, easy on those cookies, okay? Remember, they're just food, they're not love.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hate that guy! (Throws another cookie)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is lamenting to everyone about hid dad's affair.]

events.event_description: Joey laments about his father's affair and compares it to a spy leading a double life.
Rachel questions Chandler about staring at her breasts.
Ross suggests that Chandler show Rachel his private parts to resolve the tension.
Chandler refuses to show Rachel his private parts.
Ross makes a joking suggestion about Chandler showing Rachel his private parts.
Ross questions why he would marry Rachel if he thought she was a lesbian.
Roger suggests to Phoebe that they go to see a movie.
Roger says goodbye to Monica and comments on her cookies.
Roger tells Monica that cookies are just food, not love.
Monica throws a cookie in anger after Roger leaves.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler and Joey are just leaving Monica and Rachel's.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Night, you guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh look, it's the woman we ordered.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey. Can, uh, can we help you?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh, no thanks, I'm just waiting for, uh, Joey Tribbiani.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm Joey Tribbiani.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh no, not you, big Joey. Oh my God, you're so much cuter than your pictures! (Joey stares at her) I-I'm, I'm Ronni....Cheese Nip?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh, Joey's having an embolism, but I'd go for a Nip, y'know?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler and Joey are just leaving Monica and Rachel's.]

events.event_description: Joey says goodnight to Chandler and Ronni as he leaves the scene.
Chandler comments on the woman they ordered, noticing her arrival.
Joey greets the woman and asks if he can help her.
Ronni introduces herself as waiting for Joey Tribbiani.
Joey introduces himself to Ronni.
Ronni comments on Joey's appearance, saying he's cuter than his pictures.
Ronni introduces herself as Ronni, Cheese Nip.
Chandler makes a humorous remark about Joey having an embolism and suggests going for a Nip.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ronni is talking to Chandler. Joey's dad is not around.]

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Now, y'see, most people, when their pets pass on, they want 'em sorta laid out like they're sleeping. But occasionally you get your person who wants them in a pose. Like, chasing their tail, (Demonstrates) or, uh, jumping to catch a frisbee.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey, if I go first, I wanna be looking for my keys.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: That's a good one!

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Hey, Joe.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Dad, Ronni's here.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Hey! Hello, babe! Wh what're what're you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, well, you left your good hair at my apartment, I figured you'd need it tomorrow for your meeting. (Hands him the hair)

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Thank you. Uh...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, who's up for a big game of Kerplunk ?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Look, I uh, I shouldn'ta come. I-I'd better get going, I don't wanna miss the last train.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: I don't want you taking that thing.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh, where'm I gonna stay, here?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who-ah-ho.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: We'll go to a hotel.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: (Shrugs) We'll go to a hotel.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No you won't.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: No we won't.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: If you go to a hotel you'll be...doing stuff. I want you right here where I can keep an eye on you.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: You're gonna keep an eye on us?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's right, mister, and I don't care how old you are, as long as you're under my roof you're gonna live by my rules. And that means no sleeping with your girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Wow. He's strict.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Now dad, you'll be in my room, Ronni uh, you can stay in Chandler's room.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Thanks. You're, uh, you're a good kid.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: C'mon, I'll show you to my room. ...That sounds so weird when it's not followed by "No thanks, it's late."

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay. Now this is just for tonight. Starting tomorrow, you gotta make a change. This has gone on long enough.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: What kinda change?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, either you break it off with Ronni

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: I can't do that!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then you gotta come clean with Ma! This is not right!

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Yeah, but this is

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't wanna hear it! Now go to my room!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ronni is talking to Chandler. Joey's dad is not around.]

events.event_description: Ronni explains to Chandler the different ways people arrange their pets' remains after passing away.
Chandler jokes that if he goes first, he wants to be looking for his keys.
Ronni notices Joey's dad, Mr. Tribbiani, entering and greets him.
Mr. Tribbiani greets Joey and comments on Ronni's presence.
Ronni hands Mr. Tribbiani his good hair for his meeting.
Joey suggests playing a game of Kerplunk.
Ronni decides to leave to catch the last train.
Joey insists Ronni and Mr. Tribbiani stay at a hotel, but Ronni and Mr. Tribbiani agree to stay at Joey's place.
Joey states that he will monitor Ronni and Mr. Tribbiani's stay and forbids Mr. Tribbiani from sleeping with Ronni.
Joey tells his father he must stay in his room and Ronni in Chandler's room, and emphasizes that the arrangement is only for one night.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, night. Chandler and Joey are sharing the sofabed in the
living room. Joey is restless.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Kicky. What're you doing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Just trying to get comfortable. I can't sleep in my underwear.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you're gonna.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I've been thinking. Y'know, about how I'm always seeing girls on top of girls...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Are they end to end, or tall like pancakes?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'know what I mean, about how I'm always going out with all these women. And I always figured, when the right one comes along, I'd be able to be a stand-up guy and go the distance, y'know? Now I'm looking at my dad, thinking...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you're not him. You're you. When they were all over you to go into your father's pipe-fitting business, did you cave?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. You decided to go into the out-of-work actor business. Now that wasn't easy, but you did it! And I'd like to believe that when the right woman comes along, you will have the courage and the guts to say "No thanks, I'm married."

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You really think so?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. I really do.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thanks, Chandler. (Snuggles up to him)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Get off!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, night. Chandler and Joey are sharing the sofabed in the
living room. Joey is restless.]

events.event_description: Joey expresses difficulty in sleeping because he cannot sleep in his underwear.
Chandler asks Joey what he is doing.
Joey states he is trying to get comfortable.
Joey mentions he has been thinking about his relationships with women.
Chandler makes a joke about the nature of the women Joey has been seeing.
Joey reflects on his desire to be a stand-up guy when the right woman comes along.
Joey compares himself to his father, contemplating his own choices.
Chandler reassures Joey that he is not his father and encourages him to be true to himself.
Chandler reminds Joey of his decision to pursue acting over pipe-fitting.
Joey expresses gratitude to Chandler and snuggles up to him, then Chandler tells him to get off.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, morning. Someone knocks on the door and Monica gets it.]

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi...May I help you?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Yeah, uh, Joey said I could use your shower, since, uh, Chandler's in ours?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay...who are you?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm Ronni. Ronni Rappelano? The mistress?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, c'mon in.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, I'm Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bathroom's up there.

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Great.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, listen, Ronni, how long would you say Chandler's been in the shower?

dialogue.speaker: RONNI
dialogue.text: Oh, like, uh, five minutes?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Perfect. Fasten your seatbelts, it's peepee time. (She goes into Joey and Chandler's apartment, where Mr. Tribbiani is reading the paper) Hey, Mr. Trib.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Hey. Morning, dear.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Chandler Bing? It's time to see your thing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Runs out in a towel) What's the matter with you?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I thought it was Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Comes out of his room) What? What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You were supposed to be in there so I could see your thing!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sorry, my my thing was in there with me.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, morning. Someone knocks on the door and Monica gets it.]

events.event_description: Ronni knocks on the door of Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Monica answers the door to Ronni.
Ronni introduces himself to Monica and explains he is the mistress, asking to use the shower.
Monica invites Ronni into the apartment.
Rachel introduces herself to Ronni and directs him to the bathroom.
Rachel asks Ronni how long Chandler has been in the shower.
Ronni responds that Chandler has been in the shower for about five minutes.
Rachel announces that it's time to see Chandler's thing and leaves to find him.
Rachel enters Joey and Chandler's apartment and greets Mr. Tribbiani.
Chandler comes out of his room, confused about Rachel's comment about seeing his thing.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there as Phoebe enters.]

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How's it going?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Good. Oh oh! Roger's having a dinner thing and he wanted me to invite you guys.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nothing, um, it's just, um... It's Roger.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I dunno, there's just something about...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Basically we just feel that he's...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We hate that guy.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Hate him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're sorry, Pheebs, we're sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh. Okay. Okay, don't you think, maybe, though, it's just that he's so perceptive that it freaks you out?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: ...No, we hate him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We're sorry.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there as Phoebe enters.]

events.event_description: Phoebe enters Central Perk and greets everyone.
All characters greet Phoebe with 'Hey, Pheebs.'
Phoebe responds with 'Hey.'
Monica asks Phoebe how it's going.
Phoebe mentions Roger having a dinner and invites everyone.
Monica comments that nothing is going on and mentions Roger.
Ross expresses uncertainty about Roger.
Chandler states that they feel negatively about Roger.
Rachel explicitly states that they hate Roger.
All characters collectively express their hatred for Roger.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment, Joey is trying to turn the sofabed back into a
sofa. Someone knocks on the door and it rears up at him.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ma! What're you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: I came to give you this (Gives him a bag of groceries) and this. (Whacks him round the ear)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oww! Big ring!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Why did you have to fill your father's head with all that garbage about making things right? Things were fine the way they were! There's chicken in there, put it away. For God's sake, Joey, really. (She gives the sofabed a tiny push and it folds away)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hold on, you-you knew?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Of course I knew! What did you think? Your father is no James Bond. You should've heard some of his cover stories. "I'm sleeping over at my accountant's," I mean, what is that? Please!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So then how could you I mean, how could you?!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Do you remember how your father used to be? Always yelling, always yelling nothing made him happy, nothing made him happy, not that wood shop, not those stupid little ships in the bottle, nothing. Now he's happy! I mean, it's nice, he has a hobby.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ma, I don't mean to be disrespectful, but... what the hell are you talking about?! I mean, what about you?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Me? I'm fine. Look, honey, in an ideal world, there'd be no her, and your father would look like Sting. And I'll tell you something else. Ever since that poodle-stuffer came along, he's been so ashamed of himself that he's been more attentive, he's been more loving... I mean, it's like every day's our anniversary.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm...happy...for you?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Well don't be, because now everything's screwed up. I just want it the way it was.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ma, I'm sorry. I just did what I thought you'd want.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: I know you did, cookie. Oh, I know you did. So tell me. Did you see her?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. You're ten times prettier than she is.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: That's sweet. Could I take her?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: With this ring? (Her engagement ring.) No contest.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment, Joey is trying to turn the sofabed back into a
sofa. Someone knocks on the door and it rears up at him.]

events.event_description: Mrs. Tribbiani arrives at Joey's apartment and gives him a bag of groceries.
Mrs. Tribbiani whacks Joey on the ear during her visit.
Mrs. Tribbiani criticizes Joey for filling his father's head with false stories about making things right.
Mrs. Tribbiani pushes the sofabed, causing it to fold away.
Mrs. Tribbiani reveals she knew about Joey's father's hobby and cover stories.
Mrs. Tribbiani expresses her feelings about her husband's happiness and her own dissatisfaction.
Joey responds with a hesitant expression, indicating he is happy for her.
Mrs. Tribbiani questions if Joey saw the woman he was talking about.
Joey affirms that the woman is prettier than Mrs. Tribbiani and says she could take her.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe is there with Roger.]

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: What's wrong, sweetie?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nothing, nothing.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Aaaah, what's wrong, c'mon. (Pats his leg. She lies down and rests her head in his lap)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's, I mean, it's nothing, I'm fine. It's my friends. They-they have a liking problem with you. In that, um, they don't.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Oh. They don't.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But they don't see all the wonderfulness that I see. They don't see all the good stuff and all the sweet stuff. They just think you're a little...

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Intense and creepy.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But I don't. Me, Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Well, I'm not I'm not at all surprised they feel that way.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You're not? See, that's why you're so great!

dialogue.speaker: ROGER
dialogue.text: Actually it's, it's quite, y'know, typical behaviour when you have this kind of dysfunctional group dynamic. Y'know, this kind of co-dependant, emotionally stunted, sitting in your stupid coffee house with your stupid big cups which, I'm sorry, might as well have nipples on them, and you're like all 'Oh, define me! Define me! Love me, I need love!'.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe is there with Roger.]

events.event_description: Phoebe lies down and rests her head in Rogerâ€™s lap during their conversation.
Phoebe expresses to Roger that her friends dislike him and see him as intense and creepy.
Roger responds to Phoebe's concerns by acknowledging her friends' negative perception.
Phoebe defends Roger, claiming she sees his good qualities.
Roger comments that Phoebe's friends' feelings are typical of dysfunctional group dynamics.
Roger criticizes Phoebe's friends for their behavior, describing their coffee house environment and emotional dependence.
Roger sarcastically suggests that Phoebe's friends' behavior is driven by a need for love and validation.
Phoebe listens to Rogerâ€™s critique with a positive reaction, expressing admiration for him.
Phoebe and Roger continue their conversation, with Phoebe showing affection and Roger making a dismissive comment about their social environment.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is letting everyone in on the new developments.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So you talked to your dad, huh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. He's gonna keep cheating on my ma like she wanted, she's gonna keep pretending she doesn't know even though she does, and my little sister Tina can't see her husband any more because he got a restraining order...which has nothing to do with anything except that I found out today.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Things sure have changed here on Waltons mountain.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So Joey, you okay?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess. It's just parents, after a certain point, you gotta let go. Even if you know better, you've gotta let them make their own mistakes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just think, in a couple of years we get to turn into them.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If I turn into my parents, I'll either be an alcoholic blond chasing after twenty-year-old boys, or... I'll end up like my mom.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How's it going?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay, except I broke up with Roger.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Awww.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Aaawwwwww!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What happened?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't know, I mean, he's a good person, and he can be really sweet, and in some ways I think he is so right for me, it's just... I hate that guy!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is letting everyone in on the new developments.]

events.event_description: Joey explains to the group that his father is cheating on his mother and his sister Tina cannot see her husband due to a restraining order.
Rachel reacts with surprise to Joey's revelation about his family situation.
Chandler comments on how the changes in Joey's family are similar to life on Walton's Mountain.
Ross asks Joey if he is okay after hearing about his family issues.
Joey states that he believes parents must make their own mistakes and let go, despite knowing better.
Rachel comments that she and Ross will eventually become like their parents in a few years.
Chandler humorously speculates about the possible future of turning into his parents.
Phoebe enters the scene and announces that she has broken up with Roger.
The group reacts with sympathy and concern to Phoebe's breakup.
Phoebe expresses her mixed feelings about Roger, stating he is a good person but she hates him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Phoebe is reading the paper and Joey enters.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey. What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Clear the tracks for the bo

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey!! What the hell were you doing?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sorry. Wrong boobies.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello, Joey.

dialogue.speaker: MR. TRIBBIANI
dialogue.text: Oh! ...Hello, dear. (She whips the curtain shut in horror)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Phoebe is reading the paper and Joey enters.]

events.event_description: Joey enters Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Phoebe greets Joey and asks what's going on.
Joey attempts to say 'Clear the tracks for the bo', possibly an incomplete or misheard phrase.
Monica confronts Joey about his actions, saying, 'Joey!! What the hell were you doing?!'
Joey apologizes and makes a humorous remark, 'Sorry. Wrong boobies.'
Monica responds to Joey with a simple greeting, 'Hello, Joey.'
Mr. Tribbiani greets the characters and reacts with horror, whipping the curtain shut.
